page.title: 07CHANGING NATURE OF HOUSES
page.content: Eight cottages were built 180 years ago for workers at Brandenbury Farm. They were "tied" cottages so if you lost your job on the farm you lost the house also. Now they are all privately owned. All now have bathrooms, electricity and some have extensions e.g.No.2 now has 6 rooms instead of the original 4. One family have put old fashioned beams into their cottage and have also kept the wooden doors with the old iron locks. It seems from what we have heard that people in our area prefer older houses because they have more character. One interviewee said that she didn't mind extensions but she likes them to be in keeping with the house. Unfortunately some are not. Another change is that people are converting and modernising oast houses. A description of one of these is in the next section.
